headline: Emergency Declared As Flash Flooding Hits Northwest Georgia
short_description: Thunderstorms and heavy rain pounded parts of northwest Georgia on Sunday, sparking flash flooding and dangerously high waters in some areas.

headline: 'The Osbournes' Will Return In British Revival On BBC: 'Same Laughter, Love And Tears'
short_description: Millennials might remember the family's MTV reality series from the early 2000s. The BBC series will be filmed at the 350-acre Osbourne estate in England.

headline: Plane That Circled Mississippi Threatening To Crash Has Landed
short_description: A pilot has been arrested after circling a small airplane over Tupelo, Mississippi, while threatening to crash into a Walmart store.

headline: Fuel Leak Ruins NASA's 2nd Shot At Launching New Moon Rocket
short_description: Part of the space agency's Artemis program, the rocket is the most powerful to date.

headline: 9 Migrants Are Found Dead In Rio Grande: Border Patrol
short_description: Tragic toll followed hazardous crossing by desperate dozens, said officials.

headline: Owner Of New England Frozen Yogurt Shops Accused Of Hiding Camera In Store Bathroom
short_description: Nashua police charged Chanphanou (Sab) Pou with three misdemeanor counts of violation of privacy. He could face up to one year in jail for each charge.

headline: Former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone To Testify Before Grand Jury: Reports
short_description: Cipollone's former deputy Patrick Philbin is also reportedly scheduled to provide testimony to the grand jury on Friday.

headline: Tropical Storm Danielle Strengthens Into Hurricane, No Current Threat To Land
short_description: The storm — the first hurricane of an unusually quiet storm season — is centered about 885 miles west of the Azores.

headline: Putin Plans To Snub Gorbachev's Funeral
short_description: The low-key funeral reflects the Kremlin’s uneasiness about the legacy of Gorbachev, who is despised by many at home for the collapse of the Soviet Union.
authors: Jim Heintz and Vladimir Isachenkov, AP

headline: NASA Aims For Saturday Launch Of New Moon Rocket After Fixing Fuel Leaks
short_description: The inaugural flight of the 322-foot Artemis I rocket — the most powerful ever built by NASA — was delayed late in the countdown Monday.

headline: U.S. Hiring Slowed In August As Employers Add 315,000 Jobs
short_description: The unemployment rate rose to 3.7%, from a half-century low of 3.5% in July, as more Americans came off the sidelines to look for jobs.

headline: Pregnant Woman Who Claimed Unborn Baby Was HOV Lane Passenger Receives Another Ticket
short_description: Brandy Bottone had referred to Roe v. Wade and Texas' penal code, which identifies an unborn child as an individual, when she was first stopped for using the lane.

headline: Virginia Thomas Agrees To Interview With Jan. 6 Panel
short_description: Conservative activist Virginia Thomas, the wife of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas, has agreed to participate in a voluntary interview with the House panel investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection.
authors: Eric Tucker and Mary Clare Jalonick, AP

headline: Russian Cosmonaut Valery Polyakov Who Broke Record With 437-Day Stay In Space Dies At 80
short_description: Polyakov's record-breaking trip to outer space saw him orbit Earth 7,075 times and travel nearly 187 million miles.

headline: 'Reboot' Is A Clever And Not Too Navel-Gazey Look Inside TV Reboots
short_description: Starring Keegan-Michael Key, Judy Greer and Johnny Knoxville, the Hulu show follows the revival of a fictional early 2000s sitcom.

headline: Maury Wills, Base-Stealing Shortstop For Dodgers, Dies At 89
short_description: Maury Wills, who helped the Los Angeles Dodgers win three World Series titles with his base-stealing prowess, has died.

headline: 4 Russian-Controlled Ukrainian Regions Schedule Votes This Week To Join Russia
short_description: The concerted and quickening Kremlin-backed efforts to swallow up four regions could set the stage for Moscow to escalate the war.

headline: Fiona Barrels Toward Turks And Caicos Islands As Category 3 Hurricane
short_description: The Turks and Caicos Islands government imposed a curfew as the intensifying storm kept dropping copious rain over the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico.

headline: Golden Globes Returning To NBC In January After Year Off-Air
short_description: For the past 18 months, Hollywood has effectively boycotted the Globes after reports that the HFPA’s 87 members of non-American journalists included no Black members.

headline: Biden Says U.S. Forces Would Defend Taiwan If China Invaded
short_description: President issues vow as tensions with China rise.

headline: Hurricane Fiona Bears Down On Dominican Republic After Pounding Puerto Rico
short_description: The storm knocked out the power grid and unleashed floods and landslides in Puerto Rico, where the governor said the damage was “catastrophic.”

headline: One Dead After Plane Crashes At Reno Air Race
short_description: The single-engine plane was participating in the National Championship Air Races on Sunday when it crashed into a field, killing the pilot, officials said.
